articles.title: Greetings to Malawian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Malawian President 
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Arthur Peter Mutharika, president of the Republic of Malawi, on the 51st anniversary of its independence. 
					 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will be given a boost in different fields in the mutual interests, wishing the Malawian president and people bigger successes in their efforts for prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Comoros
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Comoros 
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Ikililou Dhoinine, federal president of the Comoros, on Monday on the 40th anniversary of its independence. 
					 Expressing the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries will be boosted in various fields, the message wished the president of the Comoros and its people bigger successes in their work for prosperity and development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Minister of External Relations and Cooperation of Comoros
articles.content:
Greetings to Minister of External Relations and Cooperation of Comoros
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a message of greeting to Mohamed Bakri Ben Abdoulfatah Sharif, minister of External Relations and Cooperation of Comoros, on Monday on the 40th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished the minister greater success in his work for the development of external relations of his country, expressing belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would be further strengthened by the common efforts of the foreign ministries of both countries.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the National Assembly of Vietnam led by Vice-Chairman Huyuh Ngoc Son arrived here Monday.

articles.title: Reception Given for Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Reception Given for Vietnamese Delegation 
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK gave a reception in honor of the visiting delegation of the National Assembly of Vietnam at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday. 
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation of the National Assembly of Vietnam led by Vice-Chairman Huyuh Ngoc Son, Pham Viet Hung, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were Chairman Choe Thae Bok and Vice-Chairman An Tong Chun of the Supreme People's Assembly, Thae Hyong Chol, chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Parliamentary Group, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Working People's Organizations Hold Oath-taking Meetings
articles.content:
Working People's Organizations Hold Oath-taking Meetings
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Oath-taking meetings of youth and students and agricultural workers took place Monday on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the youth league and the Union of Agricultural Workers, officials concerned, youth and students in Pyongyang City and agricultural workers in Sinchon County.
					
					 Young vanguard members held an oath-taking meeting before the statues of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill. They laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to them. 
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, read out a letter of pledge reflecting the strong faith and will of young vanguard. 
					
					 The letter said that the President brought up young people to be the strong vanguard ranks of the revolution and reliable reserves of the party till the last moments of his great life and laid an eternal foundation guaranteeing the bright future of the country and the nation. 
					
					 It is the greatest fortune and honor for the service personnel, people and youth of the DPRK to have lived and struggled, holding as the great father the leader of the people and the peerlessly great man who commanded absolute support and trust from the people for his outstanding idea, leadership and noble traits and glorified all annals of the revolution and construction with victory and glory, the letter noted.
					
					 It called for building the youth league organizations as militant and vibrant ranks and cementing it as the youth league of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and the youth organization of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 An oath-taking meeting took place at the Saegil Co-op Farm, Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province. Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 They noted that the President was the great leader, the great revolutionary and the great human being who devoted his whole life to the country and the people.
					
					 They called for discharging the responsibility and role as the master of the agricultural field in the drive for building a thriving nation, the lifetime desire of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Another Laudable Deed Showing Advantages of Korean-style Socialism
articles.content:
Another Laudable Deed Showing Advantages of Korean-style Socialism
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- It has been recently known that a 20 year-old girl is taking care of seven orphans as their real parents would do, deeply moving all the people in the DPRK.
					 Her name is Jang Jong Hwa, a worker of the Chollima District Public Catering Establishment in Nampho City who was born into a worker's family.
					
					 Among those orphans are three children of deceased workers of the Steel Workshop of the Chollima Steel Complex who had been brought up by their fellow workers.
					
					 When she made up her mind to take care of those children at her home two years ago, her parents also supported her. Later, Jang brought her home another four orphans.
					
					 From that time, she came to be known all over the city as "maiden mother" of seven children. And she has devoted her all to taking care of them with sincere support from many people in the district and city.
					
					 Under the deep care of Jang and other people, the seven children are growing up happily, free from worries.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un met her at the venue of the 2nd National Meeting of Young Frontrunners in Noble Traits and highly praised her deed, saying the word "maiden mother" can be only heard in the DPRK and such laudable deed is beyond imagination in other countries. 
					
					 As the DPRK has reliable young people like Jang Jong Hwa, who are devoting their all to the country and the future, it will shine as the power of youth forever.

articles.title: Life of President Kim Il Sung Dedicated to People
articles.content:
Life of President Kim Il Sung Dedicated to People
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- With the death anniversary of President Kim Il Sung approaching, the Koreans and the progressives of the world look back with deep yearning on his great life dedicated to the country and the nation as well as the world people.
					 Kim Il Sung was a tender-hearted father for the people, rather than the leader of a country.
					
					 Regarding it as his lifelong motto to believe in the people as in Heaven, he had always found himself among the popular masses. It was his view that the man who believes in the people gets to drink the elixir of life, while the man who turns his back on them gets to drink poison.
					
					 With this view he had made a ceaseless journey of field guidance for the people's wellbeing all his life, despite weather conditions and holidays or his birthday. In the course he sometimes pushed his car on a muddy road and spent hours in a farm village yard at dawn to meet peasants, waiting for them to get up.
					
					 From the liberation of country to the last moments of his life, he visited every corner of the country, traveling a journey of field guidance that covered more than 578 000 kilometers in total length.
					
					 That's why the Korean people have always longed for the President, calling him the great sun.
					
					 Steady continuity is given to the great sun's history of love and devotion to the people by Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, who regards it as his political view that even a star should be plucked if it is necessary for the people's happiness.

articles.title: No force Can Stem Trend of History towards Independence and Justice: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No force Can Stem Trend of History towards Independence and Justice: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- No force on earth can stem the trend of history towards independence and justice, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 As mankind is growing strong in its desire and aspiration after the struggle against the imperialists' domination and subjugation, the trend of history is heading for independence and justice, not intended by the imperialists.
					
					 Independence and justice are always sure to triumph. It is clearly proved by its historic course.
					
					 The article cites facts to prove that the U.S. has worked hard to establish a unipolar world led by it since the demise of the Cold War while styling itself the "only superpower" but it has suffered repeated setbacks in its efforts. This was attributable to its anachronistic move to stem the trend of history towards independence and justice.
					
					 The article continues:
					
					 The imperialist forces are working with bloodshot eyes to infringe upon the sovereignty of other countries under the motto of "justice". But such artifice is no longer workable.
					
					 Many independent countries including the DPRK are struggling to protect their dignity and sovereignty and achieving great victories in the stand-off with the U.S.
					
					 The day will surely come when an independent and just new world structure depending on the decisive superiority of independent forces to imperialism emerges.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Pay Heed to DPRK's Patriotic Offer
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Pay Heed to DPRK's Patriotic Offer 
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government issued a statement on the 15th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration in reflection of its steadfast will to bring about a thaw in the frozen inter-Korean relations which have pushed the situation to the brink of a war, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article. 
					 Had the south Korean puppet authorities been responsible for the destiny of the north-south relations even a bit, they would have taken a serious note of the DPRK's patriotic proposal and opted for making a policy switchover, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 However, they are rushing headlong into confrontation, defying the good faith and generosity of the DPRK. 
					
					 The confrontation maniacs took even a measure of "financial sanctions" at the prodding of the U.S. master, raising a hue and cry over "nuclear and missile threats from the north" and "human rights issue" in the north every day. 
					
					 Their frantic anti-DPRK confrontation racket is a clear revelation of their ill-intended inveterate repugnancy and hostility toward the DPRK. 
					
					 The essence of their madcap provocation against the DPRK is confrontation of social systems and its objective is a war against the north. 
					
					 The catastrophic phase of the present north-south relations proves that the true colors of the south Korean authorities can never change as they are obsessed with inveterate repugnancy toward the fellow countrymen in the north. 
					
					 The south Korean ruling quarters' persistent policy of confrontation with the DPRK would only touch off popular resistance.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Regime of Abusing Sports for Sinister Politically-motivated Purpose
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Regime of Abusing Sports for Sinister Politically-motivated Purpose
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Choe Yun Hui, chairman of the south Korean puppet Joint Chiefs of Staff, appeared in Kwangju set to host international sports games to talk rubbish that "the north is likely to commit not only terrorism but provocations" for the purpose of "disturbing the games" and cry out for "strengthening the posture to cope with them."
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 What he uttered is nothing but a ridiculous behavior of a persecution maniac and psychopath keen on hurting the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 It is worth recalling that whenever international games took place in south Korea, the DPRK rendered strong support to their successful opening through peculiar cheering and diverse activities, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 What matters is why the south Korean authorities are intensifying politico-military provocations against the DPRK together with outsiders in the run-up to the international sports games, rendering the situation on the Korean peninsula extremely tense.
					
					 Sports games can never go with confrontation racket.
					
					 No one can deny the fact that the puppet forces' anti-DPRK confrontation racket aimed to hurt the fellow countrymen and launch a war against the DPRK diametrically runs counter to the international sports games whose main idea is peace and friendship and it is no more than reckless act of seriously chilling their atmosphere.
					
					 Nevertheless, Choe vociferated about "terrorism" and "provocations" of someone. This clearly indicates the puppet regime is abusing inviolable sports games for the sinister politically-motivated purpose.
					
					 His outbursts would only escalate distrust and confrontation between the north and the south.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Lesson from Tragedy in Okinawa Seven Decades Ago
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Lesson from Tragedy in Okinawa Seven Decades Ago
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- An event "memorial day" took place in Okinawa Prefecture, Japan on June 23, 70 yeas since the Okinawa battle.
					 In the closing period of the Second World War there was a hard-fought battle between troops of the Imperial Japanese Army and the U.S. forces in Okinawa for three months, killing nearly 200 000 islanders or one quarter of its population.
					
					 The Okinawa battle remembered not only by the Japanese but by the world people with sorrow was an inevitable product of the Japanese militarists' policy of war in the past. 
					
					 In 1944 Japan had neither reserve forces to go over to offensive nor means to protect the Japan proper from air raids of U.S. forces.
					
					 The war situation already turned unfavorable to Japan.
					
					 Had Hideki Tojo and other military bosses properly judged the situation and conceded Japan's defeat, the war would have ended earlier and the Okinawa battle and tragedy of A-bombs dropping would not have taken place.
					
					 However, Japan which had become extremely fascistized due to militarism, mercilessly suppressed those who called for the end of the war and the Cabinet was reshuffled with war maniacs to take extreme measures.
					
					 Consequently, nearly two million Japanese lost their lives in the last year of the Pacific war, though 3.1 million Japanese were killed from the Sino-Japanese war to the Pacific War.
					
					 A particular mention should be made of the fact during the Okinawa battle, soldiers of the Imperial Japanese Army forced innocent inhabitants to commit "suicide" by the order of their superiors. Not content with this genocide, the soldiers massacred them.
					
					 It admits of no argument that Japanese militarists were much more cruel and brutal towards other countries and nations than towards their own people.
					
					 The people of Asia and other parts of the world should hate the past militarism of Japan and guard against its revival for generations as it pursued the policy of war and genocide, bringing so unspeakable misfortune and pain to the people of Japan and other Asian countries.
					
					 The ultra-right wing reactionary forces in Japan are getting ever more undisguised in their moves to distort the history of aggression and veer it into the Right and turn it into a military giant so that it may appear a warring state.
					
					 If such moves are allowed to go unchecked, humankind will suffer more terrible disasters than what it did seven decades ago.
					
					 A man aged 77 who took part in the event said that he became stronger in his assertion 70 years since the end of the war that a war should be averted as it causes people to suffer from diseases and starvation not only during it but in its subsequent period.
					
					 His words amount to a curse against Japanese militarism in the past and condemnation of the present Japanese reactionaries' moves to turn Japan into the Right and militarize it.
					
					 The Japanese and other Asian people should not forget the unbearable misfortune and pain brought by Japanese militarism in the past but check and foil the daily intensified moves of the Japanese reactionaries to turn Japan into the Right and militarize it.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy, the Solidarity for Progress and other civic and public organizations in south Korea held a press conference outside the Suwon District Prosecutor's Office on July 1.
					 The organizations in a press release condemned the present regime for throwing into prison Pak Chang Suk, a member of a civic organization who had conducted activities to reunify the country in a peaceful way by the concerted efforts of the nation, by invoking the "Security Law".
					
					 This is part of the suppression by the regime under the pretext of security to tide over the ruling crisis caused by the Intelligence Service's and the Cyber Command's interference in election rigging, ferry Sewol disaster, MERS case, Song Wan Jong case and other heinous cases, the organizations charged.
					
					 Pak Chang Suk's assertion that the country should be reunified in a peaceful way through dialogue and concord, away from confrontation and hostility, can never be incriminated, they said.
					
					 It is a foolish dream to tide over the ruling crisis through fascist rule, they said, adding the present regime's intensified fascist suppression will increase the people's resistance.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Urged to Opt for Improving Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Urged to Opt for Improving Inter-Korean Relations
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty in south Korea held a press conference on July 3 at which it issued a press release.
					 The press release said that 43 years have passed since the publication of the July 4 south-north joint statement which was agreed on the three principles of national reunification--independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					
					 It noted that the June 15 joint declaration which opened up a new era for south-north reconciliation and the October 4 declaration that enshrines the concrete proposal for reunification comprise the three principles of national reunification which was agreed upon at the July 4 joint statement.
					
					 It charged that the south Korean authorities have not made efforts to mend south-north relations such as the lifting of the "May 24 steps" while vociferating about "dialogue without precondition".
					
					 It demanded the authorities respect the spirit of the July 4 joint statement, stop pursuing the policy for confrontation and ensure the joint national event marking the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.

articles.title: S. Koran Organization Slams Puppet Military Group for Shunning Troop Reduction
articles.content:
S. Koran Organization Slams Puppet Military Group for Shunning Troop Reduction 
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference outside the building of the puppet Ministry of Defense in Seoul on July 1 in denunciation of the military group's belligerent action.
					 They denounced the ministry for putting forward the "draft amendment to a law on defense reform" the keynote of which is to put off the period of reduction of standing troops till 2030.
					
					 Recalling that this amendment calls for making the troops cutback 15 years later, speakers noted this is, in fact, little short of an intention not to carry out a drastic troops reduction, adding that this means completely repealing even the spurious "defense reform."
					
					 They urged the ministry to stop at once the moves to retrogressively revise the "law on defense reform".

articles.title: Remembrance Meetings Held in Various Countries
articles.content:
Remembrance Meetings Held in Various Countries
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings took place in Romania, the Czech Republic and Germany from June 27 to 29 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The participants paid tribute to the President.
					
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Socialist Party of Romania, introduced the brief biography of the President. He went on:
					
					 The President embarked upon the road of the revolution in his early years, founded the Juche idea, defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and turned the DPRK into an independent socialist state.
					
					 The Korean people are upholding him as the father of socialist Korea and eternal President of the DPRK.
					
					 Jaroslav Kafka, chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, said that several visits to the DPRK helped him know better about the personality of the President as a great man and his traits and the absolute trust of the Korean people in him.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association praised the President for performing the exploits before the country and the revolution and stressed that he would always be alive in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also the world progressives.

articles.title: Korean Book, Photo, Stamp and Handicraft Exhibition Held in Slovenia
articles.content:
Korean Book, Photo, Stamp and Handicraft Exhibition Held in Slovenia
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- A Korean book, photo, stamp and handicraft exhibition was opened in Maribor City, Slovenia on June 29 on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the visit of President Kim Il Sung to Yugoslavia.
					 On display at the venue of the exhibition were photos dealing with the exploits of the President.
					
					 Displayed there were books, photos and stamps introducing the true picture of the DPRK and handicrafts associated with the wisdom and talents of the Korean people.
					
					 The mayor of the city in a speech expressed belief that the exhibition would become an occasion of further developing the friendly relations between Slovenia and the DPRK.
					
					 Igor Jurisic, chairman of the Slovenia-Korea Friendship Association, said that not only the citizens in Maribor City but also all visitors to the venue of the exhibition would come to know better about the exploits performed by the President in accomplishing the global cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded in Bulgaria, Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded in Bulgaria, Ethiopia 
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- A seminar on exploits of President Kim Il Sung was held in Bulgaria and round-table talks in Ethiopia on June 26 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of his demise.
					 Displayed at the venue of the seminar were photos dealing with the exploits of Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union in a speech said that the President was a great revolutionary who embarked upon the road of the revolution in his teens and decorated the 20th century as one of victory of the cause of independence against imperialism and the cause of socialism with his outstanding idea, leadership and noble virtue. He went on:
					
					 The President performed the undying feats before the country and people and on behalf of the times and history with his profound ideology and theory, rare leadership and great revolutionary practice.
					
					 It is his greatest exploit that he founded the great Juche idea, pioneered the new era of the Juche revolution and led several stages of social revolution to victory.
					
					 Korean-style socialism is the greatest legacy left by him out of patriotism.
					
					 The director of an Ethiopian hospital and other speakers highly praised the President as a great man who made undying contributions to not only the Korean revolution but also the accomplishment of the global cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Romanian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Romanian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, eternal President of the DPRK, was the iron-willed brilliant commander who defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation.
					 The Romanian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said this in an article titled "Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" posted on its website on June 22.
					
					 The article said that President Kim Il Sung defeated the Japanese imperialists, achieved the country's liberation and brought about the brilliant victory in the Korean war provoked by the U.S. imperialists, the victory unprecedented in the world history of wars. It went on:
					
					 Such world-startling victory registered by the Korean people in the war was the brilliant victory of the outstanding strategy and tactics, original military tactics and rare commanding arts of the President.
					
					 The U.S. military and technical superiorities were shattered to pieces thanks to his strategy, tactics and war methods and the U.S. was compelled to kneel down before the Korean people.
					
					 Indeed, the great victory won by the Korean people in the war under the wise leadership of the President was a historic event that instilled faith and courage that any country could win if it fights out against imperialism into the progressives.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Patriotism Introduced by Peruvian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Patriotism Introduced by Peruvian Paper
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The June issue of the Peruvian paper Accion Nacionalista carried an article titled "Kim Jong Il's patriotism" illustrated with his photo.
					 The article said that leader Kim Jong Il was a peerless patriot. 
					
					 His patriotism was the most honest and ardent one, the article said, and went on:
					
					 Anyone can come to know better about the greatness of his patriotism through the painstaking efforts he exerted to defend socialist Korea and build a thriving nation.
					
					 He devoted his all to the country's prosperity and people's happiness.
					
					 His patriotism was a fundamental source which brought about the brilliant victory in defending the country and ushered in the fresh era of prosperity.
					
					 His patriotism is, indeed, the most vivid reflection of socialist patriotism and a noble example of the most ardent love for the country and people and the most positive and self-sacrificing devotion.

articles.title: Anniversary of North-South Joint Declaration Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Anniversary of North-South Joint Declaration Observed by Foreign Papers
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Guinean and Venezuelan papers carried articles to mark the 15th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The Guinean paper Horoya on June 25 in an article titled "June 15 era of reunification" said:
					
					 The basic spirit that runs through the June 15 joint declaration adopted in Pyongyang in June, 2000 is By Our Nation Itself. It calls on the north and the south to reunify the country by the concerted efforts of all Koreans free from foreign interference.
					
					 The October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing the joint declaration, was published in 2007, instilling once again the confidence in reunification into all Koreans.
					
					 The June 15 era of reunification, a landmark event in the north-south relations, is a valuable fruition of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration which affirmed that the north and the south would achieve the reunification of the country and prosperity common to the nation with the concerted efforts of the Korean nation.
					
					 The Venezuelan paper Vea in an article titled "For reunification of country" on June 23 dealt with the exploits the peerlessly great men performed by dedicating themselves to national reunification.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported in Pakistan
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported in Pakistan
						
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- We are convinced that Korea will be surely reunified under the Songun revolutionary leadership of respected HE Kim Jong Un.
					 Political parties and organizations of Pakistan noted this in a joint statement on June 25 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle. They included the Sind State Committee of the Pakistan Awami National Party, the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan People's Party, the AllÔºçPakistan Trade Union Organization, Pakistan National Federation of Trade Unions, the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan and the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 It is 70 years since Korea has been tragically divided by the U.S., noted the statement, adding:
					
					 We will together with the progressives in the world briskly conduct solidarity movement to support the Korean people in their efforts to pull the U.S. forces out of south Korea, establish new peace-keeping mechanism on the Korean peninsula and reunify the country by federal formula.
					
					 We support the south Korean people and patriots in their heroic struggle for implementing the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita aniversario 40 de independencia de Comores
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita aniversario 40 de independencia de Comores 
						
Pyongyang, 6 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 6 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Comores, Ikililou Dhoinine, con motivo del 40o aniversario de la independencia de este pais africano.
					El remitente expresa su conviccion de que las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se ampliaran y se fortaleceran en varias esferas y desea al mandatario y pueblo de Comores mayores exitos en sus trabajos por la prosperidad y el desarrollo del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a presidente de Malawi
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a presidente de Malawi
						
Pyongyang, 6 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 6 un mensaje al presidente de la Republica de Malawi, Arthur Peter Mutharika, felicitando el 51o aniversario de la independencia de este pais asiatico.
					El remitente expresa su conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran en varias ramas conforme a los intereses mutuos y desea al mandatario y pueblo de Malawi mayores exitos en sus esfuerzos por la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Acto de juramento de organizaciones de trabajadores
articles.content:
Acto de juramento de organizaciones de trabajadores 
Pyongyang, 6 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 21o aniversario del fallecimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung, tuvieron lugar el dia 6 el acto de juramento de los jovenes y estudiantes y los trabajadores agricolas, respectivamente.
					En las ocasiones estuvieron presentes el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, los funcionarios de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung (UJS), el Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea (UTAC) y otras ramas, los jovenes y estudiantes capitalinos y los trabajadores agricolas del distrito de Sinchon.
					
					En el acto de juramento efectuado ante las estatuas de bronce del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il erguidas en la colina Mansu, los participantes rindieron homenaje a ellos tras depositar un cesto y ramos de flores.
					
					El presidente del CC de la UJS, Jon Yong Nam, dio primera lectura al juramento que refleja la ferrea conviccion y voluntad de las vanguardias juveniles.
					
					El documento senala que el Presidente asento, hasta el  ultimo momento de su gran vida, la base eterna que garantiza el futuro radiante de la patria y la nacion al formar a los jovenes como filas de vanguardias fuertes de la revolucion y reservas confiables del PTC.
					
					El que han venido viviendo y luchando al tener como gran padre al lider del pueblo y gran hombre sin par quien con su destacada idea y direccion y nobles virtudes, hizo brillar con la victoria y orgullo todas las decadas de la revolucion y la construccion recibiendo el absoluto apoyo y confianza del pueblo, es la suprema fortuna y orgullo del ejercito, el pueblo y los jovenes de la Corea socialista.
					
					Subraya la necesidad de convertir las organizaciones de la UJS en las filas combativas para consolidarlas ferreamente como eterna union de la juventud de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il y como organizacion de la juventud del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					En el acto de juramento efectuado en la Granja Cooperativa de Saegil del distrito de Sinchon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, hubo el informe de Ri Myong Gil, presidente del CC de la UTAC, y las intervenciones.
					
					Los oradores destacaron que el Presidente fue el gran lider, gran revolucionario y gran hombre quien dedico todo lo suyo solo para la patria y el pueblo.
					
					Apuntaron que deben desempenar la responsabilidad y el papel como dueno de la rama agricola en la campana por construir un Estado prospero, legado de los grandes Lideres.

articles.title: "Muchacha-madre" admira a todo el mundo
articles.content:
"Muchacha-madre" admira a todo el mundo
						
Pyongyang, 6 de julio (ACNC) -- En Corea, emociona a todo el mundo el hecho de que la "muchacha-madre" Jang Jong Hwa, moradora en Kangson, lugar natal de Chollima, cuida a 7 huerfanos a la edad de 20 anos.
					Jang, obrera de la empresa de servicio gastronomico publico del municipio de Chollima de ciudad de Nampho, nacio como hija de la ordinaria cuidadora de viales y crecio bajo el gracioso regimen socialista y atencion de los obreros en el terreno.
					
					2 anos antes, ella presencio que los obreros del taller de acero del Complejo de Acero Chollima cuidaban a los tres hijos de su companero muerto y decidio cuidarlos ella misma.
					
					Sus padres apoyaron su decision de cuidar a los huerfanos con el sentimiento consanguineo.
					
					Luego se encargo de 4 huerfanos mas, asi que se propago en todo el territorio de Kangson la noticia sobre la "muchacha-madre" de 7 ninos.
					
					Todo el mundo se quedo conmovido al ver a ella que cada dia cuidaba a los ninos con toda abnegacion sin pedir ayuda a nadie.
					
					El director y los empleados de su empresa, los obreros del Complejo de Acero Chollima, los funcionarios del Comite Popular y los jovenes en el municipio, los aldeanos y los empleados de las redes de servicio fueron a ver a ella para ayudarla.
					
					En medio del amor intenso de Jang Jong Hwa y la atencion de la sociedad y el colectivo, los ninos crecen felizmente cantando la cancion "No envidiamos nada a nadie en el mundo".
					
					Hace poco, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un se reunio con Jang Jong Hwa que participo en la 2a conferencia nacional de los vanguardias jovenes en conductas loables, ocasion en la cual dijo con emocion que sus actos loables conmovieron a todo el mundo, solo en nuestro pais es posible aparecer la palabra "muchacha-madre" y en otros paises son inimaginables tales actos loables.
					
					Hoy tambien, Jang Jong Hwa recibe muchas cartas de felicitacion de todas las partes del pais.
					
					Gracias a millones de los jovenes con virtudes hermosas que dedican hasta la juventud por la patria y el futuro, la Corea socialista brilla mas como potencia de la juventud.
